New Company Has CloneCD
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2004 Topics (Year of the Venture): New Company Has CloneCD
By John Hawley on Sunday, January 25, 2004 - 05:55 pm:

I received an e-mail a few days ago that a new company has bought the rights to CloneCD from Elby. You can find it here: www.SlySoft.com. Nothing on whether this is just a reduced version of CloneCD 3 or a whole new version.

Be aware that the demo version expires in 21 days!
If you have version 2 and don't plan on upgrading, don't download the new demo.

By Silence on Sunday, January 25, 2004 - 07:47 pm:

I've been using a Slysoft version (4.3.1.7) since MR4 came out. The main difference I've seen from the past versions is that it has a set of pre-defined settings for commonly found disks such as music, data, game disk, protected game disk.
The "Keep TOC as on source" option still exists, but is called "Don't repair SubChannel data" and is not enabled by default on any of the pre-defined options. You can create and save a custom setting with it enabled, or edit one of the pre-defined ones. A new option (from what I remember of previous versions) is ignore, amplify, or emulate weak sectors. I chose ignore, and it seems to work, but I don't really know what it does. The help file seems to have information on a number of other new options that are not in my version but may be in the most recent release, so your mileage may vary.

By John Hawley on Sunday, February 1, 2004 - 06:06 pm:
